Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.mainConcepts

Class Tactic

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.mainConcepts.Tactic
Direct Known Subclasses:
Tactic.PrimitiveTactic
public class Tactic extends Object
A Tactic is needed to solve a Goal. There are the following types of tactics:
  1. A PRIMITIVE tactic, consist of just a single Action. If invoked, this tactic will execute the Action, if the latter is enabled in the current agent's state.
  2. A tactic T of the type FIRSTOF(T1,T2,...) where T1,T2,.. are tactics. Executing T will execute the first subtactic (so, T1 or T2 or ...) in the given order that has an enabled action to be executed in the current state.
  3. A tactic T of the type ANYOF(T1,T2,...) where T1,T2,.. are tactics. Executing T will execute one of the subtactic that has an enabled action to be executed in the current state.
  4. A tactic T of the type SEQ(T1,T2,T3,...) where T1,T2,.. are tactics. Executing T will execute the subtactics in sequence. Note however that an agent (instance of BasicAgent) always executes a tactic one action per tick. For example, if T1 is a SEQ of three actions, and T2 is an ANYOF two actions, and T3 is a single action, then T2 will execute at the 4th tick, and T3 at the 5th tick.
Author:
Wish
